meanings.definition: Spread out over a large area
meanings.sent1: The diffusing sunlight illuminated the entire room.
meanings.sent2: The diffusing fog made it hard to see far ahead.
meanings.sent3: The diffusing colors of the rainbow painted a beautiful sky.
meanings.sent4: The diffusing scent of fresh flowers filled the garden.
meanings.sent5: The diffusing sound of laughter echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To cause to spread or scatter widely
meanings.sent1: She was diffusing kindness wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The wind diffusing the seeds across the field.
meanings.sent3: The chef was diffusing flavors in the kitchen like a magician.
meanings.sent4: His speech diffused hope among the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The news of the victory diffused quickly through the town.

meanings.definition: To mix or intermingle by dispersion
meanings.sent1: The artist was diffusing colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The aroma diffusing from the kitchen was mouth-watering.
meanings.sent3: The children were diffusing their laughter in the playground.
meanings.sent4: The spices diffused perfectly in the stew.
meanings.sent5: The music diffused with the sounds of nature in the forest.
